column2: Single lane road, pass with extreme caution
Cars with four or more wheels and motorcycles prohibited
Follow directions for left or right turn
Solid white horizontal line means stop line
Solid white double lines marks vehicle lane
The broken white line is a stop line.
The solid yellow line and broken yellow line indicate passing prohibited in one direction
The solid yellow double line means parking prohibited.
The solid yellow line indicates the edge of the road
The broken white line is a lane line.
Solid yellow double lines mean passing is prohibited in both directions.
Solid yellow double lines mean passing in oncoming lanes is prohibited
The inverted white triangle means barrier ahead.
The white rectangular box in front of stop line is left turn area for slow vehicles and motorcycles.

The white rectanglar marking in front of the stop line shown in the picture is a motorcycle waiting zone, which allows motorcycles, except large heavy-duty motorcycles, to wait in the area during red light.
Vehicles approaching from the left must turn left
Vehicles approaching from the right must quickly pass
Vehicles in the front and rear must stop, vehicles approaching from the left and right may proceed
Vehicles approaching from the left must quickly pass
Vehicles approaching from the left must turn left
Checkered area indicates no standing in that area
Checkered area indicates standing allowed in that area
Broken yellow line is a direction separation line
Broken yellow line separates oncoming traffic lanes
Vertical white line is a longitudinal crosswalk line
Vertical white line is a zebra crossing
exclusive for autobombiles with at least 4 wheels.
No left turn for large heavy-duty motorcycle with engine capacity of 550cc or above.
warning triangle for vehicle with mechanical problems

The white rectanglar marking in front of the stop line shown in the picture is a motorcycle waiting zone, which allows motorcycles, except large heavy-duty motorcycles, to wait in the area during red light.
The white rectangular marking behind the stop line in the picture is the motorcycle waiting zone for left turn traffic.

The crosshatch marking between the crosswalk and the motorcycle waiting zone as shown in the picture is for bicycles crossing, which indicates the area where bicycles are allowed to cross the street at intersections or in the middle of the road.
The white arrow in the picture is a lane ends sign, which indicates the lane is coming to an end, and guides you to merge with the adjacent traffic.
The white arrow shown in the picture indicates a passing bay, where a car may park during emergency.
beware of bus or large passenger vehicles
